Dialogue: Thanks daddy-o.

Dialogue: Take good care of my son.

Dialogue: We'll do our best.  You're welcome to say goodbye.

Dialogue: He's a big boy.

Dialogue: What?

Dialogue: Captain Sheldrake exhibited an arrogant, controlling attitude in my presence on more than one occasion. I believe he had a personality conflict with my son from the start.

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: Well, if you don't mind my asking, sir, why did you let your son stay?

Speaker: francis
Dialogue: It was his dream to go.  I could hardly stand in the way of that, could I?

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: Is it true that you forced Robin Weathers to climb the mast when it was clear that he was acrophobic.

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: He climbed when he was ready.

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: Were you aware that his brother was killed in a fall.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: He did it man.  He sang like a bird.

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: Yes, I was.

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: Sir, were you aware at any time of the use of alcohol among the crew.

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: Yes, I was.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: And you didn't do anything about it?

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: No.  I didn't.

Speaker: charlie
Dialogue: They're twisting it all around.  Why doesn't he say something?

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: Had you ever seen a "White Squall" before this incident?

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: What makes you so sure it was one?

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: I can't be sure.

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: You really felt that your crew were up for the conditions.

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: We'd come twelve thousand miles together, through every kind of seas imaginable...

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: Except, a "White Squall".  With all due respect Captain Sheldrake, they're only boys...

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: They are much more than that, sir.

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: Is it true that the reason you expelled Philip Boutillier...

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: For killing a dolphin.

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: ... and that you invited him to strike you?  To fight it out on the deck of your ship?!

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: Yes, that's true.

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: Do you think this is funny?  Some kind of joke?  You lost six people out there.

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: I don't think one second of this is funny, sir.

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: I have no more questions at this time.

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: Oh, one last thing... Isn't true that your father was a sea Captain?

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: Isn't also true that his vessel went down off of Nantucket?  Lost everyone on board.  In fair weather no less.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: What does this have to do with anything Mr. Sanders?

Speaker: sanders
Dialogue: Oh, nothing.  I was just curious.

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: My father, was more seaman, more of a man, than you might ever hope to be.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: We'll take a brief recess.

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: There's still a way.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: It's me, don't you see.  Terry's right, I'm the escape hatch.  I disobeyed order.

Speaker: chuck
Dialogue: You taking the order wouldn't have changed anything.

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: They don't know that.  We were the only one's on deck. Look, there's nothing they can do to me right?  I'm a kid.

Speaker: chuck
Dialogue: But that's not the point...

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: That is the point... And Skipper'll slip off the hook.

Speaker: downing
Dialogue: Why didn't you turn hard to port as the wind hit?

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: I thought we'd have a better chance if I headed into the wind so we could spill air from our sails.

Speaker: downing
Dialogue: But the Captain ordered you hard to starboard.

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Twice.

Speaker: downing
Dialogue: Is that what you were trained to do?

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: downing
Dialogue: Then what do you think he was trying to do.

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Let the blow drive the boat down wind.  Neutralize our canvas.

Speaker: downing
Dialogue: So when the captain gave you an order contrary to your training, you thought he was making a mistake?

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Then why son, why didn't you follow his order?

Speaker: tod
Dialogue: Because -- I panicked.

Speaker: tod's father
Dialogue: That's not true Tod.

Speaker: terry
Dialogue: What the hell?  What is he doing.

Speaker: mike
Dialogue: Son of a gun.  He just sent Skipper a life boat.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: If this young man had responded instantly to your command, do you believe the ship might have been spared?

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: I don't know that anything could have prevented what happened.

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: Then what are you trying to say then?

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: Maybe you can't see what's happening here, but it's clear to me.  I can't bring your sons back.  If you want my ticket, if that will ease your loss, it's the least I can do.  This...

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: This is easy.  Living with it, that'll be hard.

Speaker: chuck
Dialogue: No!!!  Don't you walk away!  Not now.  Not after all of this!!!!

Speaker: tyler
Dialogue: That enough son!!  Order!!  Please!!

Speaker: chuck
Dialogue: Tell me Skipper, was it all just a lie?  "Where we go one, we go all". We listened to you.  We believed it. And we're still here!!

Speaker: chuck
Dialogue: Shame on you then Skipper.  Shame on you.

Speaker: francis
Dialogue: Sit down!

Speaker: chuck
Dialogue: Tell them the truth.  Make them understand.

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: You tell them Chuck.

Speaker: chuck
Dialogue: It's simple.  Bad things happen sometimes.  It wasn't Skipper or Tod.  It was all of us.  Everyone in this room.  Because we all knew the risks.  You sent us... You paid our tuition, you allowed us to go.  So to invent a reason for why this happened, to pin it on one person, well that won't change anything.  It'll just make our experience meaningless.

Speaker: chuck
Dialogue: If you want to judge this man, judge him by his crew.  Judge him by Alice and George.  Chris and John and Robin.  In one way or another each one of them gave their lives saving one of us.  This may sound crazy but the Albatross wasn't just a ship, or even a school.  It was something that we made, that's inside us. That's who Skipper is.  That's what he taught us.  I guess what it really was about was... the privilege of sacrifice.

Speaker: chuck
Dialogue: Isn't that right?

Speaker: skipper
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: bill
Dialogue: When the sun came up, there was whisky in the cup, and not a one of us was sober...

Speaker: crew together
Dialogue: Jenny thought she saw a picture when it really was the sun, then we knew the party was over.

Speaker: crew together
Dialogue: Oh my heart is sad, for leaving you today, but I know we'll meet again, when the moon is in the valley and the leafs are on the trees, We will come to clearly in the glen...

Speaker: harbor master
Dialogue: What do you think you're doing.

Speaker: harbor master
Dialogue: All right friend, out of the boat.

Speaker: older chuck
Dialogue: Stand away.

Speaker: older chuck
Dialogue: Rest easy old salt.  For together again, we'll sail.
